subject: Relationships
title: Dowries: Buying a Husband
description: A fast breakdown of Dowries: Buying a Husband for builders.

hook.text: In parts of India, a bride's family still pays the groom's family to marry her. The cost? A lifetime's savings.

buildup.text: Dowry originated as a woman's share of family wealth â€” her inheritance, given at marriage instead of death.

discovery.text: Over centuries, dowry transformed from female empowerment into a payment demanded by the groom's family.

twist.text: India banned dowry in 1961. Yet dowry-related deaths still number over 7,000 per year. The law changed; culture didn't.

climax.text: Dowry reveals how economics and marriage intertwine. When marriage is a market, people become commodities.

punchline.text: Dowry started as inheritance for women. It became a price tag on brides.

quiz.question: What was the original purpose of dowry?
options: A woman's share of family wealth given at marriage
